title: Introduction to Data Science in Economics and Business 1
overview: This course provides fundamental knowledge in the field of data science, serving for data analysis and big data analysis in economics and business. The analysis is aimed at solving specific requirements using data in fields such as banking finance, marketing, commerce - e-commerce, etc. The course consists of two main contents: unsupervised machine learning methods and supervised machine learning methods. The course is taught with an applied orientation, software skills are taught alongside necessary tools, illustrated by practical examples and applications, implemented on the open-source software R.

skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Apply R as a programming language and software in data analysis. Have knowledge about how to store, manage, process, and analyze data when using the R language
Apply supervised machine learning models to build models for data to analyze the impact of one variable on another variable, or to make forecasts for a target variable
Apply unsupervised machine learning models to build models for data to classify, cluster, and mine data
Develop skills in searching, processing, analyzing, transforming, and visualizing data using pre-developed packages in R such as readr, readxl, dplyr, ggplot2, stringr
Develop skills in building supervised machine learning models using R software to understand and summarize data, to analyze the relationships between variables in data, or to build predictive models
Develop the ability to self-learn, organize, manage group work, and persuade others
Develop personal responsibility, responsibility for the group, and build discipline in learning
